meanings.definition: A set of weightlifting exercises performed consecutively without rest.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his squats, he moved on to do supersets of bicep curls and tricep extensions.
meanings.sent2: She included supersets in her workout routine to maximize efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The gym enthusiast joked that supersets were like a fast-paced weightlifting dance.
meanings.sent4: In the world of weightlifting, supersets are the secret weapon for building strength quickly.
meanings.sent5: The concept of supersets revolutionized his approach to weightlifting.

meanings.definition: A group of sets performed one after the other with no rest in between.
meanings.sent1: The trainer recommended incorporating supersets into the workout plan for better results.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often use supersets to challenge their muscles and improve endurance.
meanings.sent3: During the fitness class, the instructor made the participants do supersets of push-ups and planks.
meanings.sent4: In the gym, supersets are like a relay race for your muscles.
meanings.sent5: The intensity of supersets left him feeling both exhausted and accomplished.
